author: mini_mads1980
title: Perfection In A Bag
review:
Overview

Between the 07th October and 10th November 2020 the Lego City Comic came with this motorcycle set.  The cover price was £4.25 in the UK, and this was the only set taped to the front.

Packet

The front of the packet, the standard large foil one for comics, declares that this is a Limited Edition!  It also has a nice image of the motorbike and its rider.  In the background you can see a police helicopter.  As usual too, the age recommended for this set is 5+.

The rear of the packet has the 1:1 image of the riders dark orange crash helmet and visor.

Minifigure

These sets are generally about the main character contained within the attached comic, and it's no different here.  Pete Python is the star this time around, and he is a Private Detective too.  When you first look at Pete he could easily be just a generic minifigure for anyone's city.  Without the comic you wouldn't know what his profession was.

The parts' usage for Pete are fantastic.  The dark orange helmet and his earth green torso are rare parts that are the perfect inclusion here.  The torso is printed on both sides too.  The only other City set that the torso appears in is £89.99's worth of the Tuning Workshop [60258].  It can also be found in 2020's Monkie Kids Cloud Roadster [80015] and 2021's Ninjago City Gardens [71741] which are £54.99 and £274.99 respectively, so not in low-priced sets at all.  The dark orange helmet has only appeared in one Hidden Side set, The Lighthouse of Darkness [70431], a £44.99 set.

Pete Python comprises the following parts:

  • Helmet - Dark Orange Mini Crash Helmet [6294295]
  • Visor - Transparent Brown Mini Visor 2 [6244785]
  • Head - Bright Yellow Mini Head No 3026 [6283884]
  • Torso - Earth Green Mini Upper Part 5038 [6294404]
  • Legs - Black Mini Lower Part [9339]

It would be great to have had an extra hair element to match the one in the comic, but with how rare the crash helmet is I can let that go in this instance.  Pete's head element too is quite rare, but will probably pop up in a few City sets over the next couple of years and is currently available in lower priced sets.

Main Build / Parts

The only build in this set is a motorbike.  It is a great looking bike, but with only 10 parts you won't need to follow any instructions to build it, and it should take less than a minute.  

This set though has the Motor Cycle Fairing No 8 in Dark Orange [6292494], which like parts of Pete, is a rare element.  I initially thought it was bright orange from the image in the back of the previous comic.  Currently it only appears in one set other than here, which is the Tuning Workshop mentioned above.

Verdict

I have given five stars to sets from the comics before, but this pushes that rating right to its upper limit.  The inclusion of rare parts that only currently appear in high middle to very high priced sets is great.  I can imagine in a few years someone picking up a crate of Lego from eBay or somewhere and spotting the torso and thinking they have the City Gardens set in there.

If you get a chance to get this then do so.  It certainly does not need to be used as a Private Detective and can sit on any Lego street quite happily.  If this is attached to the front of the comics in the future as the second set I will be getting a couple more just for that bike part.

When you consider what a CMF costs now, this set is a few pence more, and you get a comic too.

In the next issue it's back to a police set with Duke DeTain, and it will need to be perfect to beat this one.
